titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for William Palmer Wells papers, 1879
titlestmt.author: Collection processed and finding aid created by Bentley Historical Library Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created by Greg Kinney Nov. 2005
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

change.item: Original encoding from MARC record using Word macros and Xmetal.

titlepage.publisher:
Michigan Historical Collections
Bentley Historical Library
University of Michigan
titlepage.titleproper:
Finding aid for
William Palmer Wells Papers, 1879
titlepage.author:
Finding aid created by
Bentley Historical Library Staff

did.abstract: Professor of Law at University of Michigan. Papers consist of a communication to University of Michigan Board of Regents requesting leave of absence; doctor's report on his health; and four volumes of notes for his law lectures.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, William Palmer Wells Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: William P. Wells was a practicing lawyer in Detroit when he joined the Law Department faculty. He succeeded Charles I. Walker as Kent Professor of Law. Wells taught until 1885 and then returned to the faculty for the years 1887-1891.

scopecontent.p: The William P. Wells papers consist of a communication to University of Michigan Board of Regents requesting leave of absence; doctor's report on his health; and four volumes of notes for his law lectures.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Lawyers--Michigan--Ann Arbor.
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Dept. of Law.
